question_text: A bakery makes 15.9 cupcakes every minute. How many cupcakes can they bake in 20 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total cupcakes. Since they bake 15.9 cupcakes per minute, multiply by the number of minutes: $15.9 \\times 20$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 7.1 as 71.
Multiply: $71 \times 8 = 568$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 7.1 has 1 decimal place, and 8 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 568, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 56.8
Therefore, they can bake 318 cupcakes in 20 minutes.

solution: This is a word problem asking for total lines. Since they code 11.1 lines per minute, multiply by the number of minutes: $11.1 \\times 15$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 7.1 as 71.
Multiply: $71 \times 8 = 568$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 7.1 has 1 decimal place, and 8 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 568, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 56.8
Therefore, they can code 166.5 lines in 15 minutes.

Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 7.1 has 1 decimal place, and 8 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 568, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 56.8
Therefore, they can catch 29.6 Pokemon in 8 minutes.

question_text: A manga artist draws 17.3 pages every minute. How many pages can they draw in 7 minutes?\n
solution: This is a word problem asking for total pages. Since they draw 17.3 pages per minute, multiply by the number of minutes: $17.3 \\times 7$
To multiply a decimal by a whole number, first multiply as if both were whole numbers. Treat 7.1 as 71.
Multiply: $71 \times 8 = 568$
Count decimal places in the original numbers. The number 7.1 has 1 decimal place, and 8 has 0 decimal places. Total: 1 decimal place.
Starting from the right of 568, count 1 place to the left and put the decimal point there: 56.8
Therefore, they can draw 121.1 pages in 7 minutes.
